poem:
The Misguided Script

In the margins of ignorance,  
where certainties gather dust,  
the worn manual whispers  
a fragile misjudgment—  
misfits drawn to fervor  
by the patterns of their own hands.  
Yet, in the quiet rooms of learning,  
each child, uniquely etched,  
unfurls their own map,  
beyond our clumsy compass.
